intro: Carpolobia goetzei, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in some horticultural settings.
